answers.answer: They told me that I have them. My two hour test came back 101 and has been good also every time I check it. Only a couple times it was a little higher but I thought mine wasn't bad and I'm 36 weeks and my baby is healthy and not big at all he's gaining weight perfectly. But you seem like you definitely don't have it. My mom's friend is a dietian and he said I don't have it my number wasn't that high at all. I still check my blood of course just to make sure everything is fine with my baby. But I would talk to your Dr about that.

Thank you!  I have two sisters in the medical field that were shocked I'm having to do the test now four times a day, most people would love to have the numbers I have!  They must just want to be extra safe,  but I'm honestly sick of sticking my fingers and I'm sick of having to wait two hours after breakfast lunch and dinner to take blood sugar before getting to eat a snack... I'm a grazer and would like to eat every hour!  Lol

My glucose level was high for my 1 hour test so they sent me for the 3 hour. They only got my fasting blood sugar that time because they gave me the drink and 20 mins later I threw up. It made me so sick. My fasting was 76 and they told me that between 65-99 was normal. My dr also told me that if my blood sugar was high for only 1 of the hours they usually don't diagnose you, just reccomend diet changes. I go back to see her tomorrow for the first time since I tried to do the 3 hour test so I'm not sure what theyre going to do.

I've heard of people getting to go back for another test. They didn't even offer that to me!  I hope I can get my doctor to see that I'm healthy and don't need to do this.  I also have an ultrasound on Wednesday so I'll get to see how big baby is.  If all is fine I wonder if you can refuse to do the finger sticking? Guess I will find out!
I had it and my blood sugar was always fine but I did it up until I was induced the Friday :) and I had him at 36 weeks with pre-eclampsia so far he is a perfectly healthy baby boy

i was diagnosed and debating taking the test again cuz it seemed off. i didn't and have been testing myself ever since. 39wks now and it hasn't  been fun but the dietary changes weren't  challenging since i was eating  well before....which is why i was shocked. i had zero risk factors. i would think from the research ive done they get nervous if your fasting is elevated because you haven't eaten so that could be why they want you to test. my baby is a normal size and controlling the numbers are fine. again dr is shocked that i can control it with diet alone...which begs the question do you really have gestesinal diabetes if thats the case. it is what it is and thankfully i have avoided all complications so they aren't inducing me early and i can still have my midwife deliver the baby so i didn't fight it because im still getting what i hope to be a natural vaginal delivery.
Yea I hate pricking my finger 4 times a day. And idk to me of course anyone blood sugar would be a little high after drinking straight sugar.

To be completely honest I hate pricking my finger 4 times a day and have trouble eating the amt of carbs the dietitian said I should so I kinda just eat what I can and my levels are within range...but that doesn't mean I'm going to second guess my doctor. She's my doctor for a reason. Glucose levels tend to get worse the further along you are which is why if it is high for the 1 hour then 2 or 3 hour they make you watch your glucose levels for the rest of the pregnancy. Is it a pain in the a** yes....however it is something that I can manage for the next 10 weeks to make sure my baby is healthy and can manage their insulin once she is born.
They stuffed up part of my tests. Refuse to do it again as the glucose drink made me soo sick

question: Has anyone on here been diagnosed with gestational diabetes but feel that it was wrongly diagnosed?  I was diagnosed with it nearly two weeks ago because my fasting blood sugar was 94 during my two hour glucose test and the one at one hour and the one at two hours were both fine and normal.  Since then I've been having to poke my fingers four times a day to test and record my blood sugar... All of which have been where they want them to be.  Just feeling it's unnecessary.  Obviously I'll do whatever is best for my baby, just seems like they jumped the gun!  I'll be 30 weeks this Thursday 1/29/15. Have a doc appt on Wednesday so will be talking to doc,  just thought I'd ask here too :)
title: Gestational Diabetes question
